This will be the foundation for the first part of the CAD model. Sketch for Face 1 Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch will contain three loops and six lines, as well as two circles. - **Loop 1:** - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.6) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.6), End Point (0.555, 0.6) - Line 4: Start Point (0.555, 0.6), End Point (0.195, 0.6) - Line 5: Start Point (0.195, 0.6), End Point (0.0, 0.6) - Line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.6), End Point (0.0, 0.0) - **Loop 2:** - Circle 1: Center Point (0.195, 0.525), Radius 0.03 - **Loop 3:** - Circle 1: Center Point (0.555, 0.525), Radius 0.033 Each loop in the sketch is closed. Loop 1 consists of six lines, while Loops 2 and 3 consist of one circle each. Extrusion Once the sketch is complete and scaled by a factor of 0.75, extrude it along the normal direction by a depth of 0.003 units. Maintain a sketch scale of 0.75 and apply the "New Body Feature Operation" during the extrusion process. This part forms the foundation rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. It also includes two holes on the top surface. The part dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.003 units</description>
